workflow.name: Form to meeting: Google Calendar, Zoom, Gmail & Slack booking automation
workflow.description:
**Who‚Äôs it for**

Teams that collect meeting requests via a form and want instant, error-free scheduling: customer success, sales, education, agencies, and community managers.

**How it works / What it does**

This workflow ingests a form submission (name, email, preferred date/time), checks Google Calendar for conflicts, and branches automatically. If the slot is free, it creates a calendar event, spins up a Zoom meeting, emails the guest a confirmation, and posts a Slack summary to your team. If busy, it sends a polite ‚Äúplease pick another time‚Äù email. Time handling defaults to Asia/Tokyo and converts to ISO internally to keep downstream integrations consistent.

**How to set up**

Import the workflow and rename nodes for clarity if needed.

Open the Workflow Configuration (Set) node and adjust variables (calendar ID, meeting duration, Slack channel, sender info).

Map your form fields in Extract Booking Details.

Connect credentials in each service node (Google Calendar, Zoom, Gmail, Slack).

Test once with a real submission.

**Requirements**

Active accounts and n8n credentials for Google Calendar, Zoom, Gmail, and Slack.

A form or webhook source that sends name, email, and a valid datetime.

How to customize the workflow

Duration & buffers: Change end time calculation in Extract Booking Details.

Time zones: If you accept multiple time zones, normalize before building ISO strings.

Email copy: Personalize confirmation/alternative-time messages and add attachments if desired.

Slack format: Enrich the post with fields (host, Zoom join URL, internal tags).

Routing: Add CRM updates or reminders after the ‚Äúslot free‚Äù branch.

Security note: No hardcoded API keys in HTTP nodes. Configure all credentials via n8n‚Äôs credential manager.

workflow.name: Automated Booking Confirmation and Meeting Scheduler

parameters.subject: =Booking Confirmed: {{ new Date($('Extract Booking Details1').first().json.bookingStartISO).toLocaleString('ja-JP', { timeZone: 'Asia/Tokyo' }) }}

parameters.message:
=Hi {{ $('Extract Booking Details1').first().json.customerName }},

Thank you for your booking request. Unfortunately, the requested time slot on {{ new Date($('Extract Booking Details1').first().json.bookingStartISO).toLocaleString('ja-JP', { timeZone: 'Asia/Tokyo' }) }} is not available.

Please submit a new booking request with an alternative time.
parameters.subject: Time Slot Unavailable

parameters.content:
Title: Automated Booking ‚Üí Calendar + Zoom + Email + Slack
What this workflow does

Captures booking submissions from a form and parses date/time.

Checks Google Calendar for conflicts.

If free: creates a Calendar event ‚Üí creates a Zoom meeting ‚Üí emails the guest ‚Üí notifies your team on Slack.

If busy: emails the guest to pick another time.

Flow
Webhook ‚Üí Merge ‚Üí Config ‚Üí Extract details ‚Üí Check availability ‚Üí IF (free/busy) ‚Üí
[Free] Create Calendar Event ‚Üí Create Zoom ‚Üí Email confirmation ‚Üí Slack notify
[Busy] Email unavailability

Notes

Keep all user-editable variables in the Set nodes for easy maintenance.

Date handling assumes Asia/Tokyo input and converts to ISO for API calls.

No hardcoded credentials inside HTTP nodes; store secrets via Credentials.

Purpose: Entry point for bookings. Receives a POST payload from your form (name, email, date, time).
Output: Raw form fields under body.* used downstream.

Purpose: Normalizes/forwards webhook data to keep a single item moving through the flow.
Tip: Use this as a ‚Äúbuffer‚Äù if you ever add parallel inputs later.

Purpose: Central place for editable constants (e.g., calendarId, slackChannel, teammateEmail).
Why: Makes the template plug-and-play‚Äîupdate values here instead of hunting through nodes.

Purpose: Maps form fields to clean variables: customerName, customerEmail, bookingDate, bookingTime.
Also: Builds bookingStartISO and bookingEndISO (60-min duration) using the submitted local time (JST) ‚Üí ISO strings.

Purpose: Queries the target calendar for events overlapping bookingStartISO‚ÄìbookingEndISO.
Behavior: Returns an empty list when the slot is free; non-empty when it‚Äôs taken.

Purpose: Branches on availability.
True (empty result): Slot is free ‚Üí proceed to create the event.
False (has events): Slot is busy ‚Üí send ‚Äúunavailable‚Äù email.

Purpose: Books the time on Google Calendar with the guest as an attendee.
Fields: Summary includes guest name; Description includes name + email for quick context.

Purpose: Creates a Zoom meeting for the confirmed slot.
Timing: Uses the booking start time and a 60-minute duration.
Output: Provides join_url used by Email/Slack steps.

Purpose: Sends a confirmation to the guest with local (Japan) date/time and the Zoom link.
Subject/Body: Human-readable datetime via toLocaleString('ja-JP', { timeZone: 'Asia/Tokyo' }).
Purpose: Notifies the guest when the requested slot is already taken and asks them to rebook another time.

Purpose: Posts a concise booking summary to your specified Slack channel.
Includes: Guest name/email, localized date/time, and Zoom join_url.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
